intro: Adicea petiolaris, commonly known as the slender-stemmed adicea, is a herbaceous plant native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stems and alternate leaves that are usually ovate to lanceolate in shape. Its flowers are typically small and clustered in inflorescences, often with a distinctive calyx. Adicea petiolaris is often found in moist, well-drained soils in woodland or grassland habitats.
